When I started to use ZeroMe, 1st message was created automatically - "Hello, ZeroMe!". Every time I tried to delete this 1st message, ZeroMe was saying "deleting OK" and I found 1st message is there, but 2nd message is gone! So, try to create 2nd message (just for test), then try to delete 1st one and see what will happen. It may be "you can not delete 1st message" bug.
nie ja.

Reasons: 1) It is p2p and I like p2p (bit message, btsync, bit torrents, etc). 2) You do not need to go through ugly registration process and being involved in disgusting stuff like e-mail/login/password. How did I notice: some one mentioned ZeroNet in podcast I was listening to.
Thanks for a working link. I played similar game "IT" in the past. "Pipe Walker" looks like same game but with more levels of difficulty.

@Sick Bird: At 2016_10_08 you were saying: "zeronet users where country and native country? i'm in france and i'm french/portugal". Now you saying "I am the first indian". So who are you really? 
<A> I am french; <B> I am portugal; <C> I am the first indian; <D> I am lier and I am busted now.

@Sick Bird: So you are french who likes native american (indian) culture: language and music. You were trained to play some (undefined) indian musical instrument. It was hard for your brain to be trained to play this instrument, but people like when you playing it. And you want to collect and share indian music because you can't find and download it from internet. I am not sure it is what you meant but I tried to describe what I understood from your message. Or did you mean you want to create/compose your own music in indian stile? P.S. I can't understand french language, and I do not have any translators. G??gle makes no sense.
@ThinkProgram: "."!

You can do following:
1. Look for people that post something that you find interesting. And follow them.
2. Look for people that asks question you know nice answer. And answer them via comments.
3. "Write something..." you think might be interesting. And find people who have interest in what you saying. Look at number of "likes" of each post you wrote.

To be in situation where "asking forgiveness" is an option means you accepted blame from someone else and you feel guilt. In other words: first someone blames you, and second you can ask him/her for forgiveness. Focus on first part of timeline - someone blames you. It is more effective to do something there. You can question person who tries to blame you. In case of success you do not even need to chose to ask forgiveness or not... "Provoking feeling of guilt" - nice idea for post me to write.

@Renha: I do not understand what do you mean by that. Do you agree or disagree? And what is this article about? It is about apology. To apology is to say you understand you make something you did not mean to do. It is one thing, but asking someone for forgiveness is different. In that case you depend on other person who decide either to forgive you or not to.

@Bravo: "Freedom vs Independence". Maybe I will write a post about it. But simply idea is: freedom is resource **for** doing something, independence always **from** something. So independence is not really exist because there always is something you depend on. But freedom for doing some specific action is something you can have or you can't have at that moment.

my favorite torrent sites are: https://thepiratebay.cr and https://torrentproject.se

.1. Click "Everyone" to switch into "Everyone mode" to see posts from everyone.
.2. Under "Activity feed" at right part of this page there is "New users". Go to "Browse all" to hunt some users to follow. If you using ZeroMePlus then you will be able to see only 1000 of new users, so for that purpose you better use original ZeroMe it shows them all (2509 at this moment).

You can do following:
.1. Look for people that post something that you find interesting (use "everyone" mode to see messages from everyone). And follow them.
.2. Look for people who ask question you know nice answer. And answer them via comments.
.3. "Write something..." you think might be interesting. And find people who have interest in what you saying. Look at number of "likes" of each post you wrote.
